channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: 'I do not care about my physical body': Ricky Gervais wants lions to EAT his corpse after his death
item.description: The comedian, 59, admitted that he does not care about his physical body and instead hoped it would be torn apart at a zoo in front of horrified visitors.

item.title: Qatari royal 'lived in hotel from Pretty Woman and used fleet of supercars' while studying in LA
item.description: Sheikh Khalifa bin Hamad bin Khalifa Al Thani, 28, studied in Los Angeles, California, from 2011. The prince arrived in the city on a private jet and had an extensive entourage, including a tea servant.

item.title: Princess Mary and Prince Frederik share photos from their summer getaway with their four children
item.description: Mary, Crown Princess of Denmark, and Frederik, Crown Prince of Denmark, recently enjoyed a summer away with their four children.

item.title: Film director OLIVER STONE's memoir reveals movie flop that drove him to cocaine
item.description: OLIVER STONE: It's a consciousness that is shared by most children of divorce. That our lives, our being itself, is the creation of many lies.

item.title: Revellers gather for huge illegal block party in Notting Hill's Portobello Road in central London
item.description: Police had to use a dispersal order to break up a large crowd of Londoners illegally partying on Saturday night near Portobello Road in central London, footage has revealed.

item.title: Youths take advantage of new e-scooter rules
item.description: Youths flouted the new laws within hours of the powerful machines arriving in Middlesbrough, leading critics to accuse them of being 'open to abuse'.

item.title: Former Ferrari boss Jean Todt opens up on stricken friend Michael Schumacher
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY JONATHAN MCEVOY: Speaking in Budapest, Todt said 'I saw Michael last week. He is fighting. I hope the world will be able to see him again.'

item.title: Countess who took 30 flights on paedophile's 'Lolita Express' quits NSPCC
item.description: Clare Hazell raised thousands of pounds for the charity by hosting a classic car show each year at her family's sprawling Elveden Estate in Norfolk.

item.title: EDWARD JAY EPSTEIN investigates seemingly unsolvable mystery of how Jeffrey Epstein made his fortune
item.description: EDWARD JAY EPSTEIN: Ghislaine Maxwell may be the last person alive who knows the answers to one of the decade's great mysteries: how did Jeffrey Epstein amass his fortune and where is it now?

item.title: The Queen and Prince Philip to move to Balmoral early for holiday - but visitors cannot go near her
item.description: The Queen and Prince Philip are to move to Balmoral early for a socially-distanced summer holiday with her family - who will stay in separate buildings so she can stay safe from coronavirus

item.title: Israeli police use water cannons on demonstrators around Benjamin Netanyahu's home
item.description: Hit by high unemployment, a sharp rise in COVID-19 cases and reimposed coronavirus curbs, Israelis have taken to the streets in almost daily demonstrations against the government.

item.title: 70 trailblazing years of Princess Anne
item.description: Fearless, funny and so hard-working - we salute you PRINCESS ANNE! As she celebrates her 70th birthday

item.title: Russian Envoy dismisses claims Moscow tried to steal virus vaccine research
item.description: Russia's ambassador to the UK has rejected claims his country's intelligence services tried to steal research into coronavirus vaccines. Andrei Kelin said there was 'no sense' in the allegations

item.title: Britain's longest-suffering coronavirus patient, 35, recovers after 130 DAYS in hospital
item.description: Fatima Bridle, 35, is hoping to be reunited with her husband Tracy, 56, within weeks after spending four months apart while she battled Covid-19 at Southampton General Hospital.

item.title: English National Opera cuts short drive-in production of La Boheme to avoid a rush for the toilet
item.description: English National Opera (ENO) is staging a Covid-friendly production of Giacomo Puccini's story of two lovers in Paris in September, but the running time has been reduced.

item.title: Public support for British farmers rockets to record high
item.description: A new survey reveals that 75 per cent of Britons have a positive view of the farming industry - the highest figure since the Farmer Favourability Survey began in 2012.

item.title: Crackdown on fraudsters exposes nearly £2billion of false benefits claims and overpayments
item.description: The NFI, set up in 1996, matches electronic data within and between public and private sector bodies. It has identified £1.9 billion of incorrect payments, including £245 million in the past two years alone.

item.title: Princess Beatrice's secret marriage to Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi was untypical of Yorks' gaudy style
item.description: Discreet, dignified and thoughtful - hardly the wedding anyone would have expected from the House of York. There is none more misunderstood than Princess Beatrice.

item.title: British Muslim leader facing death penalty in Bangladesh sues Home Secretary Priti Patel for £60,000
item.description: A British Muslim leader facing the death penalty in Bangladesh for alleged war crimes is suing Home Secretary Priti Patel for £60,000 in libel damages.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer led the charge to allow ISIS bride Shamima Begum to return to Britain
item.description: As a member of Jeremy Corbyn's Shadow Cabinet, Sir Keir said in March 2019 that stripping Begum of her British citizenship 'was the wrong decision' and 'a rushed decision'.

item.title: EVGENY LEBEDEV: Coronavirus is creating a catastrophe for our wildlife
item.description: From the forests of eastern India to the grasslands of Kenya, there is a new conservation emergency. We have been told that Botswana has lost 10 per cent of its rhinoceroses since March.

item.title: Civil servants claim they do not feel comfortable with a Treasury room named after Winston Churchill
item.description: Civil servants have complained to their superiors that they 'do not feel comfortable' with a room in the Treasury being named after former British Prime Minister Winston Churchill.

item.title: Sunseekers flock to Barcelona's beaches despite being told to stay at home in 'voluntary lockdown'
item.description: The streets of Barcelona were empty on Saturday following the Catalan regional government's decision to go into a 'voluntary lockdown' over the weekend due to a spike in COVID-19 cases.

item.title: Annie Nightingale kept John Lennon and Yoko Ono's relationship secret for fear of breaking trust
item.description: Veteran broadcaster Annie Nightingale knew about John Lennon and Yoko Ono's relationship before it was made public - but did not report the story for fear of breaking her bond of trust with The Beatles.

item.title: Fears of catching coronavirus in hospital led to 1,750 extra deaths from cardiac problems
item.description: Fears of catching coronavirus in hospital led to more than 1,750 people than normal dying of cardiac problems because they ignored warning signs and stayed at home

item.title: England cricket star Sir Ian Botham appears to confirm he is set to become a House of Lords peer
item.description: The England cricket star and commentator grinned when he was approached by The Mail on Sunday at his £2 million mansion yesterday and asked whether he is to be ennobled.

item.title: How most road accidents take place during the day in fine weather
item.description: A new study has found that the majority of road accidents take place in the day without a rain cloud in sight - and at speeds of between 21-30mph.

item.title: Senior civil servant provokes storm as he endorses Black Lives Matter in email to hundreds of staff
item.description: Senior civil servant Iain Bell has caused a storm by claiming that 'systemic racism' exists in Britain and endorsing the Black Lives Matter (BLM) movement in an email to hundreds of staff.

item.title: Now woke Hollywood's casting agents are looking for actor to play a non-binary HOUSE
item.description: Producers of Our Own Devices, a £10 million film starring British singer FKA twigs, are seeking someone to play the voice of the 'House'.

item.title: 'Boundaries separating adults from children, men from women, humans from animals are being eroded'
item.description: Teaching children to 'know their boundaries' is a vital part of their education. This is because throughout history, boundaries have played a key role in communities making moral distinctions

item.title: Black Lives Matter activists protest across the world including in London, France and Germany
item.description: Black Lives Matter protests took place across the world on Sunday, including in central London where Oxford Circus was blocked by activists. The demonstrations blocked the busy London road.

item.title: Knifeman's lawyer says charges against him should be dropped after police officer knelt on his neck
item.description: Marcus Coutain, 48, was filmed pleading with officers to 'get off my neck' as he was handcuffed on the pavement as an officer put his knee of the man's neck in Islington on Thursday.

item.title: Brawl on the empty streets of Magaluf's party strip as thugs throw a metal bin across the street
item.description: A video has emerged showing a violent brawl in the middle of a deserted street in Magaluf once popular with British tourists but now shut down after the government responded to earlier bad behaviour

item.title: JOHN GRAY: It's not an exaggeration to compare methods of new 'woke movement' to Mao's Red Guards
item.description: JOHN GRAY: Today we are no longer living in a free society. Instead, we are ruled by those who try to enforce their extreme views by shaming and ruining those who think differently.

item.title: Photograph taken of Dominic Cummings at which shows a remarkably different side to rebel aide
item.description: With his crumpled shirts and quilted gilets, Dominic Cummings always cuts a determinedly scruffy figure striding through Downing Street. But as newly unearthed pictures show the Tory aide differently.

item.title: First black woman to run for US presidency declared 'You don't make any progress on the sidelines'
item.description: Shirley Chisholm (pictured), the first black woman ever to run for US president, has remained largely ignored by history - until now.
item.media:credit: The LIFE Images Collection via G

item.title: GPs' appointments become available for cash at private clinics while NHS surgeries stay shut
item.description: Family doctors employed at NHS surgeries that have suspended routine face-to-face appointments are working for private practices where they are happy to see patients in person for cash.

item.title: Britain records 40 more coronavirus deaths amid 'review' of counting methods
item.description: Today's figures are down from last Saturday's 140 coronavirus-associated deaths across the UK recorded by the Department for Health and Social Care.

item.title: Chinese owned TikTok's plans to establish a global HQ in Britain are now in doubt after Huawei row
item.description: A controversial Chinese social-media firm's plans to establish its global headquarters in the UK have been thrown into doubt amid growing concern about Beijing's influence in Britain.

item.title: Test and trace would not prevent second coronavirus wave, as 'system identifies a third it needs'
item.description: The UK's coronavirus test and trace system would not stop the feared second wave because it can only find a third of the people it needs, a top civil servant admitted last night in bad news for go to work drive

item.title: Princess Beatrice follows Royal Myrtle tradition for her stunning bridal bouquet
item.description: Princess Beatrice upheld royal tradition as sprigs of myrtle were included in her breathtaking bridal bouquet. She married Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, yesterday in a secret ceremony in Windsor.

item.title: Chinese firm on same banned list as Huawei makes British police radios for officers protecting No10
item.description: Police radios used by tens of thousands of officers are made by a company whose Chinese owner has been banned by Donald Trump over national security fears to the United States.

item.title: Britain won't need another national lockdown, claims Boris Johnson
item.description: The PM says he does not believe it will be necessary to enforce another national lockdown but suggested it should be held in reserve like the nuclear deterrent.

item.title: Playing in front of home fans makes football teams WORSE
item.description: The Financial Times said its analysis 'counters the assumption that teams gain an edge from partisan crowds providing additional motivation to home players'.
item.media:credit: West Ham United FC via Getty Ima

item.title: Get back to office as an example to the nation, Boris Johnson orders his Cabinet
item.description: Boris Johnson has ordered his cabinet into a large room in the Foreign Office where they can conduct the business of government while keeping well apart.

item.title: Boris Johnson and Carrie Symonds share a photograph of their son
item.description: Carrie Symonds and Boris Johnson gave only the second glimpse of their son Wilfred yesterday in a photo released to thank hospital staff who cared for him.

item.title: Banks deny loans to borrowers who took 'payment holidays'
item.description: Banks in Britain have rejected customers who - after the Covid-19 lockdown began - chose to take breaks from repaying home loans, credit cards and car finance loans.

item.title: Julian Lewis, the new boss of Westminster's spy committee, 'had lobbied Boris Johnson for the job'
item.description: The new boss of Westminster's 'spy committee' was accused of hypocrisy last night over claims that he had privately lobbied Boris Johnson to guarantee he would land the plum post.

item.title: Britain's farmers celebrate bumper crop of cherries
item.description: A decade after cherry orchards were almost wiped out in Britain, farmers are celebrating such a bumper crop this year that they are able to export the fruit around the world.

item.title: Dozens of patients sue the NHS over claims they suffered brain damage after having therapy
item.description: Dozens of patients who underwent a highly controversial form of treatment for depression are suing the NHS claiming they suffered brain damage.

item.title: Magic of Christmas will be lost if Cinders doesn't go to the ball
item.description: Sadly, there is a depressing prospect that Cinderella won't go to the ball and the Prince won't kiss his Sleeping Beauty at Christmas this year, writes ARLENE PHILLIPS.

item.title: Queen allows granddaughter to wear treasured heirloom from her own wedding in 1947
item.description: The Queen allowed her 31-year-old granddaughter, Princess Beatrice, to wear the same tiara she wore at her own wedding in 1947.

item.title: Second-hand taffata gown with bodice encrusted with diamante was huge message of support from Queen
item.description: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN: Fashion is so often used to make a statement and this gown, personally loaned by the Queen, sends a huge message of her support to a much-loved granddaughter.

item.title: Beatrice poses with new husband Edoardo and her grandparents after socially distanced wedding
item.description: Princess Beatrice married on Friday wearing both a tiara and vintage dress generously lent to her by her grandmother, deeply conscious that the 31-year-old was missing out on a traditional large wedding.

item.title: DAN HODGES: Stop playing 'whack a mole', Boris Johnson - or it WILL be YOU who gets whacked
item.description: DAN HODGES: Boris loves the whack-a-mole line,' a Minister reveals. 'It's clear he came up with it himself. If you're in a meeting with him, he'll keep using it.'

item.title: How Tanya Maniktala, the new queen of Sunday night TV, kept calling her Suitable Boy co-star 'Sir'
item.description: She is heading for global fame as the lead character in the BBC's new drama A Suitable Boy, but screen newcomer Tanya Maniktala couldn't help acting the starstruck fan on set.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Amazon slashes price on new book about Prince Harry and Meghan Markle
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: Finding Freedom, due out next month, will chart the events leading up to Megxit and the Sussexes' move to the United States.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Cressida Bonas fears she will never reach her full potential
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: The 31-year-old, who stepped out with the Duke of Sussex for two years, won plaudits for her role in ITV drama White House Farm earlier this year.

item.title: PETER HITCHENS: Face masks turn us into voiceless submissives
item.description: PETER HITCHENS: The Government began its wild, disproportionate shutdown of the country by spreading fear of a devastating plague that would destroy the NHS and kill untold thousands.

item.title: Leeds legends unite in fight to save pitches where they first played
item.description: Stars including former England international David Batty forged their fledgling careers playing for Leeds City Boys at the TV Harrison Ground, the proposed site for a development of 61 homes.

item.title: Newlyweds Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi's manage to bring the fun to low-key reception
item.description: The newlyweds (pictured) dubbed their reception marquee The Duke of York and filled it with sofas, a jukebox, draft beer and a dartboard.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER WILSON: Minimalist wedding ceremony for Princess Beatrice was the ideal solution
item.description: CHRISTOPHER WILSON: The 'secret' wedding at the Chapel of All Saints on the Windsor estate, arranged at short notice, eradicated the gnawing problem of how to handle the public profile of Prince Andrew.

item.title: 'I was always the drunk party girl...'
item.description: But when the socialising stopped during lockdown and Jamie Klingler still kept hitting the rosé, she was forced to admit she had a serious problem

item.title: Boris Johnson faces calls to back new 'empire-neutral' public honour ahead of COVID-19 heroes awards
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is being urged to back a new 'empire-neutral' public honour as part of plans to reward the heroes of the fight against the coronavirus pandemic this autumn.

item.title: Woman tipped for top No10 job in bullying row: Claims made over diplomat who loved to mix with stars
item.description: A Whitehall high-flyer tipped to become the first-ever female head of the Civil Service was investigated for bullying staff and misusing expenses, The Mail on Sunday can reveal.

item.title: Police face growing pressure to ground noisy helicopters and instead use drones to fight crime
item.description: Residents complain of being kept awake at night and left unable to work from home because of the din of circling helicopters, with London having 2,500 flights overhead last year.

item.title: How TV soap operas such as Coronation Street force images of alcohol on young people
item.description: We're all used to the sight of the regulars raising a glass in the Rovers Return, but television soap operas are forcing images of drinking on young people, warns a new academic study.

item.title: Prince William says Covid-19 means Britain will 'never have a better chance' to tackle homelessness
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge said the UK has the opportunity to 'crack' homelessness during a visit to a drop-in day centre for the homeless community in Peterborough.

item.title: Boss of service station firm Moto calls on Chancellor Rishi Sunak to slash fuel tax from 20% to 5%
item.description: Moto chief executive Ken McMeikan has written to Chancellor Rishi Sunak with a plea to consider an 'immediate VAT reduction on fuel', from 20 per cent to 5 per cent.

item.title: You don't need to wear a mask at the gym
item.description: Under Government guidelines drawn up in consultation with UKactive, gyms are instead introducing stricter safe distancing guidelines, with members exercising two metres apart.

item.title: Duke of Edinburgh looks back to his best alongside the Queen in Princess Beatrice wedding picture
item.description: In an official photo released today (left), Prince Philip stood beside his wife of 73 years in a smart dark coloured suit, white shirt and striped tie, beaming at the newly married couple

item.title: Has Brooklyn Beckham found a venue at the five-star Borgo Egnazia in Italy for his wedding?
item.description: Brooklyn Beckham could be set for an even more extravagant affair than his parents when marries model Nicola Peltz. His mother Victoria, took the couple around a romantic Italian palazzo last week.

item.title: SAS snipers target British jihadis' cave hideaways in Iraq
item.description: Defence sources last night confirmed that there have been at least ten battles in northern Iraq in the past three months, with further secret operations in neighbouring Syria.

item.title: Princess Beatrice will be a 'doting stepmother' to her new husband's four-year-old son, say friends
item.description: Princess Beatrice will be a 'doting stepmother', friends said last night. Her husband Edo already has a four-year-old son, Christopher Woolf Mapelli Mozzi - known as Wolfie.

item.title: Personal assistant caught on camera 'buying an electric saw HOURS before murder of boss'
item.description: Police say Saleh was beheaded and dismembered inside the $2.2 million residence on Monday afternoon, before his remains were found by a family member the following day.

item.title: Former top Labour official could sue party over 'false claims'
item.description: The Mail on Sunday can reveal that ex-party general secretary Iain McNicol is considering legal action over references to him in the 800-page document.

item.title: Paul Hollywood's ex-wife Alex 'raking in a five-figure sum a year from Bake Off star'
item.description: It has been claimed that the cookery writer, 55, could be raking in a huge five-figure sum every year following her split from the Great British Bake Off star, 54.

item.title: Baby boy cradled by Princess Diana speaks about an unbreakable bond which makes him feel blessed
item.description: There aren't many 24-year-olds who enjoy looking at their baby pictures, fewer still who show them off to friends. But James Whetton has good reason to boast about one photograph.

item.title: Edo Mapelli Mozzi's ex Dara Huang spends Princess Beatrice's big day drinking with friends
item.description: On the day her former fiance Edo Mapelli Mozzi married Princess Beatrice, Dara Huang enjoyed a relaxed and carefree evening sharing drinks with friends in London on Friday.

item.title: Riley Keough breaks silence about her 'angelic baby' brother Benjamin's suicide
item.description: The grieving 31-year-old shared a slideshow of herself with the late musician, who reportedly felt enormous pressure to live up to their grandfather Elvis Presley's legacy

item.title: Having a clear-out can boost your finances by £4,300
item.description: Coronavirus has impacted everyone's finances one way or another, but fortunately there are ways to give your bank balance a much-needed boost.

item.title: Thorpe Park visitor 'stabs another ridegoer in the stomach'
item.description: Thorpe Park in Surrey was locked down between 4pm and 6pm after a visitor was 'seriously injured', a spokesman for the park has confirmed.

item.title: 30,000 kidney dialysis patients to benefit from no-scar operation...thanks to micro magnets in veins
item.description: The innovative procedure creates a super-strong needle access point into the body that can cope with the large amount of blood taken out during treatment.

item.title: 'Will and Jada's turbulent marriage? They'd told me all about it already'
item.description: Movie superstar Will Smith and his actress wife Jada Pinkett Smith have sparked worldwide shock and bemusement by publicly discussing their turbulent 22-year marriage

item.title: Will every person over 50 get a flu jab on the NHS this winter?
item.description: Matt Hancock and the government are looking to 'consider all options' to avoid a double-whammy scenario of a bad flu season and a second wave of Covid-19.

item.title: Mysteries of the senses: The boy who broke almost every bone in his body - but didn't feel any pain
item.description: Paul Walters, and sister Vicky, from Essex, were born with the disorder congenital analgesia in which messages that normally carry 'warnings' of pain in the brain are somehow interrupted.

item.title: You CAN have a good death in hospital, insists top surgeon
item.description: LIZ O'RIORDAN: If you're anything like me, you probably spend a fair bit of time wondering where to go on holiday or where to go for a nice walk. But do you ever consider where you want to die?

item.title: BONNIE ESTRIDGE on life with Alzheimer's: A new test for my illness… sniffing peanut butter!
item.description: BONNIE ESTRIDGE: Have you heard of the peanut butter test for Alzheimer's? If you can't smell it, it could be an early-warning sign of the disease.

item.title: DR ELLIE CANNON: Not being able to see patients in person is good for them, me and the NHS
item.description: DR ELLIE CANNON: For years we've been shopping, banking and ordering takeaways online, but the NHS was lagging well behind. It was clear it needed an upgrade.

item.title: Fad dieting risks ruining your chance of being a mum, fertility experts warn
item.description: Such regimes, medics say, can cause long-term damage, making conception difficult, sometimes, impossible. They warn of a generation of women risking infertility in a quest to be thin.

item.title: HEALTH NOTES: Trial for motor neurone drug and why cycling could risk men's sex life
item.description: Bike sales have soared during lockdown. But men may want to think twice before donning Lycra and getting in the saddle, as research suggests it could put them at an increased risk of impotence.

item.title: Great British Boltholes: A review of Greenbank Hotel Falmouth, Cornwall
item.description: The Greenbank's perfect waterside location allows guests to jump on and off ferries during their stay, take watersport lessons, or even hire a boat to explore miles of inlets and estuaries.

item.title: Sailing to Europe? It's such a breeze now ferries are back in business
item.description: Every week our Holiday Hero Neil Simpson takes an in-depth look at an important holiday topic. This week: why ferries to Europe are set to win new fans this summer.

item.title: How the British countryside inspired famous composers, from the Malvern Hills to the Suffolk coast
item.description: The Mail on Sunday's Sarah Turner explores areas of the UK that have influenced the work of some of Britain's finest composers, from the Suffolk Coast to the Malvern Hills.

item.title: Burgundy by bicycle: Saddle up for a vintage ride through wine country
item.description: The Mail on Sunday's Jo Kessel and her daughter went on a cycling holiday in France. The journey took them on a 100-mile loop from Macon in southern Burgundy.

item.title: Working from home, masks in shops and sport: DR ELLIE CANNON answers your questions on coronavirus
item.description: DR ELLIE CANNON: The Mail on Sunday's GP discusses whether we should be going back to work, why face coverings aren't needed in takeaways and more in this week's column.

item.title: Prince Andrew 'said the Queen Mother and Queen both had the "gift of the gab"'
item.description: An adult masseuse hired in 1999 to give Prince Andrew a treatment during a stay at Little St James in the US Virgin Islands said she was told he and his grandmother both had the 'gift of the gab'.

item.title: 'I'm still Captain Tom... not SIR Tom': Fundraising hero brushes off honorary title
item.description: 'I'm still Captain Tom,' he told today's BBC Breakfast today. 'I think that's the easy one. People will be able to remember, so just straight forward Captain Tom, or if we get a bit closer, just Tom.'

item.title: How to be ready for Chancellor raising capital gains tax
item.description: Some experts believe capital gains tax represents low-hanging fruit for Sunak, given that it is levied at rates lower than those applied to income.

item.title: Shampoo ad earned TV's Jenny Powell a cool £60,000
item.description: Powell, who rose to fame on programmes No Limits and Wheel Of Fortune, says the best money decision she ever made was buying her home following her divorce.

item.title: Pictured: 'Ex-lover' of McCann suspect is seen for first time since being unmasked
item.description: Nicole Fehlinger, pictured in Bavaria, was last night revealed as the German drifter's accomplice who could hold the key to unlocking the mystery of what happened to Madeleine McCann.

item.title: Montana woman trips while running away from a charging bison and plays dead to survive attack
item.description: A video caught the moment when an unidentified Montana woman runs away from a charging bison while at the Nez Perce Creek in the Wyoming section of Yellowstone national park.

item.title: Armed police search homes in quaint Devon market town
item.description: Armed officers carrying semi-automatic weapons and baton round launchers searched for armed suspects following a stabbing in Totnes, Devon earlier this afternoon.

item.title: Murder probe after man, 19, is stabbed to death in Leicester
item.description: A 19-year-old man was murdered this morning in a stabbing in Bartholomew Street in Leicester. The victim was found around 3.30am. Officers later arrested an 18-year-old man shortly afterwards.

item.title: Protester is grabbed by federal agents without identification and forced into an unmarked minivan
item.description: US Attorney Billy Williams of Oregon has requested an investigation into federal agents deployed to Portland, who have been seen arresting Black Lives Matter protesters without identification

item.title: UN chief says the world is 'at the breaking point' after months of coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Antonio Guterres said that Covid-19 pandemic 'has been likened to an X-ray, revealing fractures in the fragile skeleton of the societies we have built' as he delivered the Nelson Mandela Annual Lecture.

item.title: Dominic Cummings leaves his London home wearing a straw hat and holding a stick
item.description: Even the Prime Minister's chief adviser took advantage of the scorching weather today as he was seen leaving his home wearing a straw hat and clutching a wooden stick.

item.title: Beaches and parks brace for an onslaught of visitors as temperatures are set to hit 82F today
item.description: The Met Office forecast a split in temperatures between the two regions with a 'fairly grey' day for northern England and north Wales but scorching conditions in the south-east.

item.title: Inferno engulfs Nantes cathedral as 60 firefighters battle to save 1434 church
item.description: Prosecutor Pierre Sennes told reporters three fires had been started at the site in Nantes and authorities were treating the incident as a criminal act. He gave no other details.

item.title: 'Visionary' Time Out founder Tony Elliott who launched magazine during a summer holiday dies aged 73
item.description: Tributes have been paid to Time Out magazine founder Tony Elliott who died of cancer aged 73. Tony founded the magazine in 1968 while on vacation from university at his home in Kensington

item.title: Funeral of Sudanese asylum seeker, 28, shot dead by police in Glasgow is delayed by an hour
item.description: Badreddin Abadlla Adam, 28, was due to be buried at Linn Cemetery in Glasgow at 2pm this afternoon. Pictured, crowds arriving at the ceremony to pay their respects.

item.title: Phone data shows only a handful of workers are commuting into UK's deserted big cities
item.description: Only one in eight workers in London has returned to the office, compared to nearly 50 per cent in Basildon, Essex. Some two-thirds of workers don't want to return to work yet.

item.title: British teenager denies being behind Twitter hack but admits he bought stolen account with Bitcoin
item.description: Joseph O'Connor, a well-known hacker who goes by the name 'PlugWalkJoe', told the New York Times he was not involved in Wednesday's massive breach.

item.title: Lycra-clad cyclist is filmed screaming shocking rant at pregnant driver who beeped at him
item.description: A cyclist launched into a tirade at a pregnant woman after he was accused of breaching the Highway Code by cycling two abreast 'in the middle' of a road in Cleethorpes, Grimsby.

item.title: Police arrest woman, 29, over murder of 16-year-old Louise Smith
item.description: The teenager was last seen alive in Somborne Drive in the Leigh Park area of Havant, Hampshire, at midday on May 8. Her body was found at nearby Havant Thicket on May 21.
item.media:description: A woman has been re-arrested on suspicion of murder of 16-year-old Louise Smith (Hampshire Constabulary/PA Media)

item.title: Shocking moment road rage driver attacks bin lorry driver then picks up 'hammer' to hit dustman
item.description: A man got out of his car to attack dustbin men working for the City Bin Company in Donaghmede, Dublin on July 17. Footage of the shocking moment was captured by a resident on the street.

item.title: Take That star Howard Donald shares photoshopped image of himself with David Bowie on Instagram
item.description: Take That star Howard Donald uploaded a picture of David Bowie photoshopped over Gary Barlow's face making it appear like he was posing with the Ziggy Stardust singer.

item.title: Anti-Putin protesters take to streets of Russian town bordering China over arrest of governor
item.description: At least 10,000 people are said to have marched in Khabarovsk on Saturday, demanding the release of a popular regional governor Sergei Furgal, who was arrested on July 9 on suspicion of murder.

item.title: BBC presenter turned evangelical preacher, 44, admits 40 sex offences against children
item.description: Former BBC presenter Benjamin David Thomas, 44, admitted 40 sex offences across 30 years when appearing at appeared at Mold Crown Court in Wales on Friday.

item.title: Police charge 16-year-old boy with murder after man, 20, was stabbed to death during knife fight
item.description: A 16-year-old boy, from Dewsbury, has been charged with the murder of Bradley Stewart Gledhill, 20, who was stabbed to death in Batley, West Yorkshire on June 21.

item.title: Teenager arrested after MMA fighter was stabbed to death while toasting his 30th birthday in London
item.description: Another two men were stabbed in London last night as violence explodes in the post-lockdown capital with the total number of murders in the past two weeks up to 10.

item.title: Austalian Olympic figure skater Ekaterina Alexandrovskaya dies after 'jumping' from a window
item.description: Figure skater Ekaterina Alexandrovskaya died at the age of 20 in Moscow on Friday. The Russian-born skater competed for Australia in the Pyeongchang Olympics in 2018.

item.title: Teenager who lives at home with his mother in UK is 'among hacking group behind Twitter attack'
item.description: One of the hijackers who goes by the moniker 'lol' was described by his accomplice 'ever so anxious' as a 19-year-old who lives in the south of England with his mother.

item.title: Quiz challenges you to name these 14 dog breeds - can you find them all?
item.description: The online challenge, from Playbuzz user Michael Rogers asks you to identify the breeds of the 15 dogs from around the world pictured in the images below.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson shares her first Instagram post since Princess Beatrice's secret Windsor wedding
item.description: Sarah Ferguson has shared her first Instagram post since news broke of her daughter Princess Beatrice's secret wedding ceremony broke yesterday.

item.title: 'Please don't let me die': Last words of graduate, 24, after 40ft fall while escaping burning car
item.description: Azra Kemal, 24, slipped through a 10ft wide void between two carriageways on a road bridge on the A21 between Sevenoaks and Tonbridge on Thursday.

item.title: Dad who rescued his 10-year-old from the clutches of a shark is praised as a terrific family man
item.description: Mr Arnott was fishing with his son Lucas, off Stanley on Tasmania's Northwest coast when a shark leaped out of the water and dragged the child off the boat on Friday afternoon.

item.title: Sheepish father of the bride Prince Andrew is spotted 25 hours after Princess Beatrice's wedding
item.description: The shamed royal looked abashed as he drove off the grounds of Windsor in a black Range Rover just after attending the first 'secret' royal wedding for 234 years.

item.title: Exam board withdraws textbook featuring cartoon of black tribe cooking a white missionary
item.description: AQA - one of the UK's three main examination bodies - said that the GCSE psychology textbook that included the cartoon should never have been approved.

item.title: Incredible moment daring skateboarder jumps off an 11-foot-tall Sydney bus in amazing TikTok stunt
item.description: Video shows the skateboarder ride across the bus and jump onto a glass shelter just before the bus drives off on one of Sydney's busiest streets.

item.title: Home of Daily Mail columnist Nigel Dempster is for sale for £4.25million
item.description: The home of Nigel Dempster - who was best known for his celebrity gossip column in the Daily Mail - is on the market for £4.25m via Savills estate agents.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's 'husband' Scott Borgerson talked up dating high profile woman but not identity
item.description: The man who is rumored to be Ghislaine Maxwell's husband, Scott Borgerson, is said to have told his parents he was dating a 'high profile woman'. The pair recently lived together in New Hampshire.

item.title: Model who was arrested on a flight from Melbourne to LA says she was 'inappropriately touched'
item.description: Adau Mornyang, 26, boarded the United Airlines on January 21 last year, with a visa not set to expire until December 2021.
